mftools.fingerprint package

Submodules

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints module

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.get_dict(input_path, micro_list, feature_generator, cnn=None, red_feat=False, nfeatures=None)[source]

Get dictionary of features from list of input images.

Parameters

  • input_path (str) – Path to image data.

  • micro_list (list) – List of image filenames.

  • feature_generator (mftools.fingerprint.generate_features) – Feature generation method. Options are available in the mftools.fingerprint.generate_features module.

  • cnn (str or None, optional) –

    None (default)

    Feature generator is not based on CNN architecture.

    ’alexnet’

    Generates CNN features from AlexNet architecture.

    ’vgg’

    Generates CNN features from VGG architecture.

  • red_feat (bool, optional) –

    False (default)

    Full feature stack is used for fingerprint construction.

    True

    Feature stack is reduced for each image separately via PCA from shape \((P, d)\) to shape (nfeatures, \(d\)), where \(d\) is the dimension of each feature vector and \(P\) is number of features in the dictionary/population (requires \(P > d\)).

  • nfeatures (int, optional) – Number of features to reduce each image’s feature stack to. If None, feature stack is reduced to shape \((d, d)\), where \(d\) is the dimension of each feature vector.

Returns

dict – Dictionary of features with shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of features and d is the length of each feature.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.get_fingerprint(image, kmeans, feature_generator, order='h0', cnn=None, red_feat=False, nfeatures=None)[source]

Call a specified function for extracting \(H_l\) fingerprints, where \(l\) denotes the order of the fingerprint.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Image data.

  • kmeans (sklearn.cluster.kmeans) – \(k\)-means cluster model corresponding to dictionary of features from the whole dataset.

  • feature_generator (mftools.fingerprint.generate_features) – Feature generation method. Options are available in the mftools.fingerprint.generate_features module.

  • order (str, optional) –

    ‘h0’ (default)

    Return \(H_0\) fingerprint.

    ’h1’

    Return \(H_1\) fingerprint.

    ’h1v’

    Return \(H_1^v\) fingerprint.

    ’h2’

    Return \(H_2\) fingerprint.

    ’h2v’

    Return \(H_2^v\) fingerprint.

  • cnn (str or None, optional) –

    None (default)

    Feature generator is not based on CNN architecture.

    ’alexnet’

    Generates CNN features from AlexNet architecture.

    ’vgg’

    Generates CNN features from VGG architecture.

  • red_feat (bool, optional) –

    False (default)

    Full feature stack is used for fingerprint construction.

    True

    Feature stack is reduced for each image separately via PCA from shape \((P, d)\) to shape (nfeatures, \(d\)), where \(d\) is the dimension of each feature vector and \(P\) is number of features in the dictionary/population (requires \(P > d\)).

  • nfeatures (int, optional) – Number of features to reduce each image’s feature stack to. If None, feature stack is reduced to shape \((d, d)\), where \(d\) is the dimension of each feature vector.

Returns

fingerprint – Fingerprint of specified order.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.get_fingerprints_cnn(input_path, micro_list, feature_generator, cnn='alexnet')[source]

Generate fingerprints for whole images based on CNN features alone.

Parameters

  • input_path (str) – Path to image data.

  • micro_list (list) – List of image filenames.

  • feature_generator (mftools.fingerprint.generate_features) – Feature generation method. Options are available in the mftools.fingerprint.generate_features module.

  • cnn (str, optional) –

    ‘alexnet’ (default)

    Generates CNN features from AlexNet architecture.

    ’vgg’

    Generates CNN features from VGG architecture.

Returns

fingerprints – Array of fingerprints with shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of input images and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.get_fingerprints_hl(input_path, micro_list, kmeans, feature_generator, order='h0', cnn=None, red_feat=False, nfeatures=None)[source]

Generate fingerprints for whole images based on \(H_{l}\) framework, where \(l\) denotes the order of the fingerprint.

Parameters

  • input_path (str) – Path to image data.

  • micro_list (list) – List of image filenames.

  • kmeans (sklearn.cluster.kmeans) – \(k\)-means cluster model corresponding to dictionary of features from the whole dataset.

  • feature_generator (mftools.fingerprint.generate_features) – Feature generation method. Options are available in the mftools.fingerprint.generate_features module.

  • order (str, optional) –

    ‘h0’ (default)

    Return \(H_0\) fingerprint.

    ’h1’

    Return \(H_1\) fingerprint.

    ’h1v’

    Return \(H_1^v\) fingerprint.

    ’h2’

    Return \(H_2\) fingerprint.

    ’h2v’

    Return \(H_2^v\) fingerprint.

  • cnn (str or None, optional) –

    None (default)

    Feature generator is not based on CNN architecture.

    ’alexnet’

    Generates CNN features from AlexNet architecture.

    ’vgg’

    Generates CNN features from VGG architecture.

  • red_feat (bool, optional) –

    False (default)

    Full feature stack is used for fingerprint construction.

    True

    Feature stack is reduced for each image separately via PCA from shape \((P, d)\) to shape (nfeatures, \(d\)), where \(d\) is the dimension of each feature vector and \(P\) is number of features in the dictionary/population (requires \(P > d\)).

  • nfeatures (int, optional) – Number of features to reduce each image’s feature stack to. If None, feature stack is reduced to shape \((d, d)\), where \(d\) is the dimension of each feature vector.

Returns

fingerprints – Array of fingerprints with shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of input images and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.learn_labeling(dict, nclust)[source]

Train cluster model on dictionary of features.

Parameters

  • dict (ndarray) – Dictionary of features with shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of features and \(d\) is the length of each feature.

  • nclust (int) – Number of clusters to assign when training \(k\)-means model.

Returns

kmeans – Trained \(k\)-means cluster model corresponding to dictionary input.

Return type

sklearn.cluster.kmeans

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.order_fingerprints(fingerprints, label_list)[source]

Order fingerprint stack such that rows ordered such that class labels are in ascending order and columns are ordered such that the mean of fingerprints with class label 0 is in ascending order.

Parameters

  • fingerprints (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of input images and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • label_list (ndarray) – Vector of class labels corresponding to fingerprints, with shape \((N, )\), where \(N\) is the number of input images.

Returns

fingerprints_ordered – Array of fingerprints, ordered such as described above.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.reduce_fingerprints(fingerprints, ncomponents=None)[source]

Apply PCA reuction to fingerprints to reduce from shape \((N, K)\) to shape (ncomponents, \(K\)), where \(K\) is the dimension of each fingerprint and \(N\) is number of fingerprints in the stack (requires \(N > K\)).

Parameters

  • fingerprints (ndarray) – Array of fingerprints with shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of input images and \(d\) is the length of each fingerprint.

  • ncomponents (int, optional) – Number of components to reduce each image’s fingerprint to. If None, feature stack is reduced to shape \((K, K)\), where \(K\) is the dimension of each fingerprint.

Returns

fingerprints_reduced – Array of fingerprints reduced via PCA, as described above.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.single_image_fingerprint_h0(xfeat, kmeans)[source]

Generate fingerprint \(H_0\) from \(k\)-means predictions of cluster centres from single image features.

Parameters

  • xfeat (ndarray) – Dictionary of features with shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of features and \(d\) is the length of each feature.

  • kmeans (sklearn.cluster.kmeans) – \(k\)-means cluster model corresponding to dictionary of features from the whole dataset.

Returns

fingerprint – \(H_0\) fingerprint.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.fingerprints.single_image_fingerprint_h1(xfeat, kmeans)[source]

Generate fingerprint \(H_1\) from \(k\)-means predictions of cluster centres from single image features.

Parameters

  • kmeans (sklearn.cluster.kmeans) – \(k\)-means cluster model corresponding to dictionary of features from the whole dataset.

Returns

Return type

mftools.fingerprint.generate_features module

mftools.fingerprint.generate_features.generate_feature_cnn_featdict(image, cnn='alexnet')[source]

Generate dictionary of features from CNN output.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Image data.

  • cnn (str, optional) –

    ‘alexnet’ (default)

    Generates CNN features from AlexNet architecture.

    ’vgg’

    Generates CNN features from VGG architecture.

Returns

xfeat – Array of features. Has shape \((N, d)\), where \(N\) is the number of features in the final convolution output and d is the dimension of each feature.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.generate_features.generate_feature_cnn_flatten(image, cnn='alexnet')[source]

Generate feature vector from final convolution layer by flattening.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Image data.

  • cnn (str, optional) –

    ‘alexnet’ (default)

    Generates CNN features from AlexNet architecture.

    ’vgg’

    Generates CNN features from VGG architecture.

Returns

xfeat – Array of features. Has shape \((N, )\), where \(N\) is the number of voxels in the final convolution output.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.generate_features.generate_feature_cnn_maxpool(image, cnn='alexnet')[source]

Generate single feature vector from final convolution layer of CNN via apply MaxPooling.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Image data.

  • cnn (str, optional) –

    ‘alexnet’ (default)

    Generates CNN features from AlexNet architecture.

    ’vgg’

    Generates CNN features from VGG architecture.

Returns

xfeat – Array of features. Has shape \((d, )\), where \(d\) is length of each feature output from the final convolution layer.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.generate_features.generate_feature_sift(image)[source]

Extract scale invariant feature transform (SIFT) features from a single image.

Parameters

image (ndarray) – Image data.

Returns

xfeat – Array of features. Has shape \((N, 128)\), where \(N\) is the number of features extracted.

Return type

ndarray

mftools.fingerprint.generate_features.generate_feature_surf(image)[source]

Extract speeded-up robust features (SURF) from a single image.

Parameters

image (ndarray) – Image data.

Returns

xfeat – Array of features. Has shape \((N, 64)\), where \(N\) is the number of features extracted.

Return type

ndarray
